data.title: Laureates: the Nobel Prize in Literature - a staff-created list from Sno-Isle Libraries — Sno-Isle Libraries
data.meta_description:
The Nobel Prize in Literature is awarded annually by Swedish Academy to an author for "outstanding work in an idealistic direction." It is one of the world's most prestigious literary awards.

The Nobel is not awarded for one book, but for an author's entire work. For this list, we've selected one noteworthy work from each Laureate.
data.text:
Jon Fosse (1959- ) is a Norwegian author and playwright known for deep introspection and minimalism. The Nobel Committee, in awarding him the Nobel Prize for Literature in 2023, praised him for giving "voice to the unsayable."

Annie Ernaux (1940- )is a French writer known mostly for memoirs and autobiographical novels. She has been praised for the courage and clarity with which she depicts her own memories. She won the Nobel Prize for Literature in 2022.

Louise Gluck (1943- ) is an American poet and essayist. She is known for autobiographical poems of unusual emotional intensity. She was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2020.

Book

Peter Handke (1942- ) is an Austrian novelist, playwright and poet, a member of the avant-garde. His works often reflect the deadening effects of living in an irrational world. He was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2019.

Book

Olga Tokarczuk (1962- ) is a Polish poet, novelist, and activist. Her works contend with Polish history and identity, often in a humorous and satirical tone. She was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2018.

Munro, Alice, 1931-

Alice Munro (1931- ), a Canadian author, is generally regarded as one of the greatest-ever authors of short stories. Her works often depict the inner lives of seemingly-ordinary women. She was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2013.

Mo Yan (1955- ) is a Chinese novelist and short-story writer. His works often combine magical realism, folk tales, history, and social criticism. He was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2012.

Tomas Tranströmer (1931-2015) was a Swedish poet. His poems have been praised for depicting a sense of possibly-religious mystery and wonder underlying everyday life. He was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2011.

Orhan Pamuk (1952- ) is a Turkish novelist. Many of his books include people struggling with conflict between Eastern and Western values. He was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2006, the first winner from Turkey.
